item.title: Mojave National Preserve Boundary Adjustment Act of 2016

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Lands.

item.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Senate Subcommittee on National Parks. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 114-502.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

summary.text:
Mojave National Preserve Boundary Adjustment Act of 2016

This bill directs the Department of the Interior to transfer administrative jurisdiction over 520 acres of federal land from the National Park Service to the Bureau of Land Management. Interior may acquire by donation up to four acres of land identified in the land protection plan of the Mojave National Preserve as suitable for acquisition to be used for mitigation for every one acre of land removed from the Preserve.

The acquired land shall become part of the Preserve.

Interior shall permit cattle grazing on the acquired land according to National Park Service laws and policies.

bill.title: Mojave National Preserve Boundary Adjustment Act of 2016

item.title: Mojave National Preserve Boundary Adjustment Act of 2016
A bill to adjust the boundary of the Mojave National Preserve.
Mojave National Preserve Boundary Adjustment Act of 2016

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
